text.section:
A person is guilty of assault in the fourth degree when:
He intentionally or wantonly causes physical injury to another person; or
With recklessness he causes physical injury to another person by means of a deadly weapon or a dangerous instrument.
Assault in the fourth degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 429, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1982. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 67, effective January 1, 1975.
